title: How to Make Free Beer

text: Combine all of the malt and crush.  Combine with water at approx. 55 to 60-degrees Celsius for about 1-2 hours. Filter the extract and discard the solids. The remaining liquid should be approx. 10 kg of extract. Bring the malt extract, the hops (both types), and about 70 L of water to a boil.  Add guarana beans and sugar.  Boil for about 30 minutes.  Allow the mixture to simmer for about 1 hour.  Filter completely and store liquid in a sealed container until cool.  Add yeast. Allow to ferment approximately 1 week at room temperature. After fermentation is complete, transfer the beer into bottles, adding 4 g of sugar per liter and the remaining yeast that has settled to the bottom of the container.  Store for approximately 8-10 days to carbonate.
